archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Technology Architecture
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
The technology architecture describes the hardware, software, and network infrastructure needed to support the deployment of applications.
Infrastructure (<<Node>>)
Description: Physical computing and network resources.
Examples:
• Hospital data centers • Server clusters • Cloud infrastructure • Network hardware • Mobile device infrastructure
Platform (<<System Software>>)
Description: Foundational software environments that host applications.
Examples:
• Operating systems • Virtualization platforms • Database management systems • Container orchestration platforms • Application servers
Network (<<Communication Path>>)
Description: Communication infrastructure connecting systems.
Examples:
• Hospital Wi-Fi networks • Secure clinical networks • Remote site connectivity • Telemedicine networking • Internet of Medical Things (IoMT) networks
Technology Service (<<Technology Service>>)
Description: Technical capabilities provided by the infrastructure.
Examples:
• Data backup services • Load balancing • Disaster recovery • Authentication services • High-availability clustering

children.name: Tecnology Architecture View
children.documentation:
Technology Architecture (Technology Layer)
Components:
• Infrastructure (Node) • Platform (System Software) • Network (Communication Path) • Technology Service (Technology Service)
Examples:
• Infrastructure: Cloud VM hosting EHR • Platform: AWS Lambda • Network: Secure VPN • Technology Service: Storage as a Service
